get

import requests
query= input(â€œè¾“å…¥ä½ æƒ³æœç´¢çš„ä¸œè¥¿\nâ€)
url = fâ€™https://www.sogou.com/web?query={query}â€˜

headers = {
â€œuser-agentâ€:â€Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/130.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/130.0.0.0â€
}
resp = requests.get(url,headers=headers)

print(resp)
print(resp.text)
resp.close()

post

import requests

url = â€œhttps://fanyi.baidu.com/sugâ€œ

word=input(â€œè¾“å…¥æƒ³ç¿»è¯‘çš„å•è¯â€)
dat={
â€œkwâ€:word
}

print(resp.json())
resp.close()

re

import re
import csv

findall å¾ˆå°çš„æ–‡ä»¶å¯ä»¥ç”¨

lst=re.findall(râ€\d+â€,â€my10086â€)
print(lst)

finditer è¿­ä»£å™¨?æœ€å¸¸ç”¨

it=re.finditer(râ€\d+â€,â€my10086â€)
for i in it:
print(i.group())

searchåªæ‰¾åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªç»“æœå°±è¿”å›

#searchè¿”å›æ˜¯matchå¯¹è±¡,æ‹¿æ•°æ®è¦.group()

matchå¿…é¡»ä»å¤´åŒ¹é…

s = re.match(râ€\d+â€,â€my10086â€)
print(s.group())

é¢„åŠ è½½æ­£åˆ™è¡¨è¾¾å¼

obj = re.compile(râ€\d+â€)
it = obj.finditer(â€œ1234â€)
for i in it:
print(i.group())

it = obj.finditer(â€œ5678â€)
for i in it:
print(i.group())

æŸ¥æ‰¾é™å®šç»„

obj = re.compile(â€œxxx.?xxx(?P.?)â€,re.S)
result = obj.finditer(s)
#å–æ‰€æœ‰ç»„
for i in result:
print(i.group())
#å–æŸä¸ªç»„ #(?Pæ­£åˆ™)
for i in result:
print(i.group(â€œnameâ€))

entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.
